text: <!channel> any opposition to adding a “UX” tag for blog posts?
i’ll take that as a no. <@U02613K0X> would you be able to add that when you have time?
pretty please
oh wow I didn't even notice your earlier message
and yeah np I'll post in here when it's up
oh I forgot we changed tags up a bit
thanks!

I forgot for Hercules we cut down our tags to only five and have that "Filter" list on the blog page. I'm happy to add it to the CMS but we'll also need a front end change to add it to that Filter list.
That may have some design repercussions
<@U02618EV1|gaston> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/gaston/F0BMDQM1N/pasted_image_at_2015_10_01_11_25.png|Pasted image at 2015-10-01, 11:25>
Not against adding the tag at all but just making a note so we can test the site after adding it.

Cool. Let’s add it and see how it works with the current design. We’ll run it by Matt and see if there are any changes he wants to make. It would probably be good to have a slightly more scaleable approach in the future.
<@U02618EV1> is that filter list on the blog page not dynamic?
Unfortunately it isn’t :disappointed:

Added it to the CMS (haven't pushed it live yet) so you'll be able to add it to a post but there are some functional frontend kinks as well that we should be sure to fix before melissa published. Namely directing this link somewhere useful: <http://uncorkedstudios.com/blog/ux> and being careful about our capitalization (some places auto-capitalizes the first letter only of tags, which looks bad when UX is Ux)
It’s hardcoded in a couple of places.
we should update the list of tags to be dynamic and dictate a capitalization for each in the future
Seems like a larger update now which is perfectly fine. Would love to add it as a new feature (get Abby involved, etc).
agreed

<@U0260V1BX> you should be able to add it to your post in the CMS now, but we'll probably want to add it to the hard-coded lists on the front end before publishing (alternatively you could publish now and add the UX tag later when everything's ready)
thank you! i can wait til later to add the tag
Hey guys sorry just catching up - Yea let's add it to the hardcoded list on the front end. I'm fine either way in terms of when we add the tag in the CMS.
<@U02618EV1>: and <@U02HAJ6JF> I'm going to come chat with you guys in a bit about hercules updates and a new request so we can touch base about this then
<@U02HAJ6JF|joshua> has joined the channel
Question for you Abby, does it make sense to add it to the hard coded list now or to set up some time and refactor that section to make it scalable?
Personally I think we should add it to the harcoded list - this is really the only addition we've needed to make in a while and we specifically want to keep the list small and curated
Agreed. Will add it to trello
Thanks Gaston!
Hey Abby! Didn’t see you slacked me. I’m around.
No worries at all, and apparently the ask I had for you guys went away/turned into something else :confused:
Way to make us curious :wink:
Ha sorry, just a pitch deck that we thought we were going to do website style but turns out they need it today
so PDF it is!
No, no worries. JK.

<!channel>: I’m back!

re: tags. I think we designed this when we had some alignment on “holy shit we have too many tags!” Also, I remember we liked how the tags matched up with our sections in the case studies. (ie, UX would fall under the “design” section)

That’s probably changed now, which is cool. We’ll just need to figure out way to handle more tags in the front-end without going to crazy. 

Just to check, do we have (or are planning on having) a lot of UX specific blog posts that we want to separate or sift out of the handful of design posts?
and also, more specific dev, or fabrication, posts that we’ll want to separate from that mix?
if so, we should come up with something fast, if not. maybe we can wait until we poke around in Hercules again.

i’d have to go back and look - i am about to publish one that is UX specific. seems like a good categorization to have moving forward. I’m not too concerned about there being 100% parity with the case study sections...
i dont think its a rush at all
word
i’m also happy to keep this filed under Design if we want to re-think the whole shebang later
we should add it to that trello board
